   - Deductions are available for business expenses.

2. Partnership:
   - Partners report their share of the business income or loss on their personal tax return (Form 1065).
   - Each partner pays income tax on their share of the income, but self-employment tax is paid only on their share of the business profits.
   - Partnerships do not pay income tax at the entity level.

3. Limited Liability Company (LLC):
   - By default, an LLC is taxed as a disregarded entity (similar to a sole proprietorship) or a partnership, depending on the number of members.
